gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material with more than 63 percent SiO2.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:acidic_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: acidic igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with more than 63 percent SiO2.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:acidic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: acidic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock mainly consisting of green, brown or black amphibole and plagioclase (including albite), which combined form 75 percent or more of the rock, and both of which are present as major constituents. The amphibole constitutes 50 percent or more of the total mafic constituents and is present in an amount of 30 percent or more. other common minerals include quartz, clinopyroxene, garnet, epidote-group minerals, biotite, titanite and scapolite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:amphibolite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: amphibolites
amphibolite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained crystalline rock, usually porphyritic, consisting of plagioclase (frequently zoned from labradorite to oligoclase), pyroxene, hornblende and/or biotite. color index M less than 35. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field O2 as andesite. Fine grained equivalent of dioritic rock.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:andesitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: andésites
andesitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: General term for a leucocratic phaneritic crystalline rock consisting essentially of plagioclase, often with small amounts of pyroxene. colour index M less than 10. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 10 as anorthosite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:anorthositic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: anorthositic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material known to have artificial (human-related) origin. insufficient information to classify in more detail.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:anthropogenic_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: anthropogenic material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated material known to have artificial (human-related) origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:anthropogenic_unconsolidated_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: anthropogenic unconsolidated material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock that is too fine grained to categorize in more detail.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:aphanite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: aphanite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Light coloured crystalline rock, characterized by a fine grained allotriomorphic-granular (aplitic, saccharoidal or xenomorphic) texture. typically granitic composition, consisting of quartz, K-feldspar and sodic plagioclase.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:aplite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: aplite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Tephra in which average grain size of particles is less than 2 mm.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:ash
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: ash

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine-grained or porphyritic igneous rock with less than 20 percent quartz, and less than 10 percent feldspathoid minerals, in which the ratio of plagioclase to alkali feldspar is greater than 66 percent, and the color index is greater than 35. Typically composed of calcic plagioclase and clinopyroxene. phenocrysts typically include one or more of calcic plagioclase, clinopyroxene, orthopyroxene, and olivine. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field B as basalt.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:basaltic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: basaltes
basaltic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material with between 45 and 52 percent SiO2.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:basic_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: basic igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with between 45 and 52 percent SiO2.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:basic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: basic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Highly aluminous material containing abundant aluminium hydroxides (gibbsite, less commonly boehmite, diaspore) and aluminium-substituted iron oxides or hydroxides and generally minor or negligible kaolin minerals. may contain up to 20 percent quartz. Commonly has a pisolitic or nodular texture, and may be cemented.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:bauxite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: bauxite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment composed of greater than 50 percent material of biogenic origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:biogenic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: biogenic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by biological processes within the basin of deposition.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:biogenic_silica_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: biogenic silica sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary carbonate rock with preserved biogenic texture, whose original components were bound and encrusted together during deposition by the action of plants and animals during deposition, and remained substantially in the position of growth.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:boundstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: boundstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Coarse-grained material composed of angular broken rock fragments. the fragments typically have sharp edges and unworn corners. The fragments may be held together by a mineral cement, or in a fine-grained matrix. Clasts may be of any composition or origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:breccia
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: breccia

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fault material with features such as void spaces (filled or unfilled), or unconsolidated matrix material between fragments, indicating loss of cohesion during deformation. Includes fault-related breccia and gouge.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:breccia-gouge_series
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: breccia-gouge series

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: cailloutis
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:cailloutis
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: cailloutis
cailloutis

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment with a calcite (plus aragonite) to dolomite ratio greater than 1 to 1. Includes lime-sediments.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:calcareous_carbonate_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: calcareous carbonate sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation state with a calcite (plus aragonite) to dolomite ratio greater than 1 to 1. Includes lime-sediments, limestone and dolomitic limestone.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:calcareous_carbonate_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: calcareous carbonate sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with a calcite (plus aragonite) to dolomite ratio greater than 1 to 1. Includes limestone and dolomitic limestone.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:calcareous_carbonate_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: calcareous carbonate sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment composed of more than 25 percent gravel-sized clasts (maximum diameter more than 2 mm).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_gravel
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate gravel

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment composed of more than 75 percent mud-sized clasts (maximum diameter less than 32 microns).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_mud
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate mud

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with matrix-supported fabric, composed of more than 75 percent mud-sized grains (maximum diameter less than 32 microns). The original depositional texture is preserved.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_mudstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate mudstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment composed of more than 75 percent sand-sized clasts (maximum diameter between 32 microns and 2 mm).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_sand
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate sand

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are composed of one (or more) of the carbonate minerals calcite, aragonite and dolomite, in particles of intrabasinal origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are composed of one (or more) of the carbonate minerals calcite, aragonite and dolomite, in particles of intrabasinal origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are composed of one (or more) of the carbonate minerals calcite, aragonite and dolomite, in particles of intrabasinal origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with discernible mud supported depositional texture and containing greater than 10 percent grains.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonate_wackestone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonate wackestone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock composed of more than 50 percent modal carbonate minerals.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:carbonatite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonatite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fault-related rock that maintained primary cohesion during deformation, with matrix comprising 50 to 90 percent of rock mass. matrix is fine-grained material caused by tectonic grainsize reduction. Includes cataclasite, protocataclasite and ultracataclasite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:cataclasite_series
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: cataclasite series

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment that consists of at least 50 percent material produced by chemical (organic or inorganic) processes within the basin of deposition. Includes organic-rich, non-clastic siliceous, carbonate, evaporite, iron-rich, and phosphatic sediment classes.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:chemical_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: chemical sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment in which at least 50 percent of the constituent particles were derived from erosion, weathering, or mass-wasting of pre-existing earth materials, and transported to the place of deposition by mechanical agents such as water, wind, ice and gravity.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:clastic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: clastic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation state in which at least 50 percent of the constituent particles were derived from erosion, weathering, or mass-wasting of pre-existing earth materials, and transported to the place of deposition by mechanical agents such as water, wind, ice and gravity.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:clastic_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: clastic sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock in which at least 50 percent of the constituent particles were derived from erosion, weathering, or mass-wasting of pre-existing earth materials, and transported to the place of deposition by mechanical agents such as water, wind, ice and gravity.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:clastic_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: clastic sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Hard, black, organic rich sedimentary rock that yields greater than 8,300 Btu on a moist, mineral-matter-free basis, or contains greater than 69 percent fixed carbon on a dry, mineral-matter-free basis. formed from the compaction or induration of variously altered plant remains similar to those of peaty deposits.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:coal
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: coal

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material of unspecified consolidation state formed by geological modification of pre-existing materials outside the realm of igneous and sedimentary processes. Includes rocks formed by impact metamorphism, standard dynamothermal metamorphism, brittle deformation, weathering, metasomatism and hydrothermal alteration (diagenesis is a sedimentary process in this context).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:composite_(transformed)_genesis_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: composite (transformed) genesis material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed by geological modification of pre-existing rocks outside the realm of igneous and sedimentary processes. Includes rocks formed by impact metamorphism, standard dynamothermal metamorphism, brittle deformation, weathering, metasomatism and hydrothermal alteration (diagenesis is a sedimentary process in this context).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:composite_(transformed)_genesis_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: composite (transformed) genesis rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Coarse grained sedimentary rock composed of at least 30 percent rounded to subangular fragments larger than 2 mm in diameter. typically contains finer grained material in interstices between larger fragments.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:conglomerate
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: conglomérats
conglomerate

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate rock of indeterminate mineralogy in which diagenetic processes have obliterated any original depositional texture.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:crystalline_carbonate
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: crystalline carbonate

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained or porphyritic crystalline rock composed of quartz and sodic plagioclase with minor amounts of biotite and/or hornblende and/or pyroxene. volcanic equivalent of granodiorite and tonalite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 4 and 5 or chemically in TAS Field O3.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:dacitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dacitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unsorted or poorly sorted, clastic sedimentary rock with a wide range of particle sizes such that it cannot be assigned to any other class.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:diamictite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: diamictite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unsorted or poorly sorted, clastic sediment with a wide range of particle sizes such that it cannot be assigned to any other class.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:diamicton
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: diamicton

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of intermediate plagioclase, commonly with hornblende and often with biotite or augite. colour index M less than 90, sodic plagioclase (An0-An50). Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 10 as diorite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:diorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: diorites
diorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock with M less than 90, consisting of intermediate plagioclase, commonly with hornblende and often with biotite or augite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 as diorite, monzodiorite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:dioritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dioritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Dark colored gabbroic (basaltic) or dioritic (andesitic) rock intermediate in grain size between basalt and gabbro and composed of plagioclase, pyroxene and opaque minerals. often with ophitic texture. Typically occurs as hypabyssal intrusions. Includes dolerite, microdiorite, diabase and microgabbro.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:doleritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dolérites
doleritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation degree with a ratio of magnesium carbonate to calcite (plus aragonite) greater than 1 to 1. Includes dolomite sediment, dolostone, lime dolostone and magnesite-stone.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:dolomitic_or_magnesian_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dolomitic or magnesian sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with a ratio of magnesium carbonate to calcite (plus aragonite) greater than 1 to 1. Includes dolostone, lime dolostone and magnesite-stone.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:dolomitic_or_magnesian_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dolomitic or magnesian sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment with a ratio of magnesium carbonate to calcite (plus aragonite) greater than 1 to 1.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:dolomitic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dolomitic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock forming a hard crust or layer at or near the Earth's surface at the time of formation, e.g. in the upper horizons of a soil, characterized by structures indicative of pedogenic origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:duricrust
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: duricrust

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock composed of 75 percent or more (by volume) omphacite and garnet, both of which are present as major constituents, the amount of neither of them being higher than 75 percent (by volume). the presence of plagioclase precludes classification as an eclogite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:eclogite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: eclogite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Nonclastic sedimentary rock composed of at least 50 percent non-carbonate salts, including chloride, sulfate or borate minerals. formed through precipitation of mineral salts from a saline solution (non-carbonate salt rock).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:evaporite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: evaporite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock containing greater than 10 percent melilite or kalsilite. Typically undersaturated, ultrapotassic (kalsilitic rocks) or calcium-rich (melilitic rocks) mafic or ultramafic rocks.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:exotic_alkalic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: exotic alkalic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Kimberlite, lamproite, or lamprophyre. Generally are potassic, mafic or ultramafic rocks. Olivine (commonly serpentinized in kimberlite), and phlogopite are significant constituents.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:exotic_alkaline_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: exotic alkaline rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock with 'exotic' mineralogical, textural or field setting characteristics. typically dark colored, with abundant phenocrysts. Criteria include: presence of greater than 10 percent melilite or leucite. presence of kalsilite. greater than 50 percent carbonate minerals.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:exotic_composition_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: exotic composition igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material formed as a result brittle faulting, composed of greater than 10 percent matrix. matrix is fine-grained material caused by tectonic grainsize reduction. Includes cohesive (cataclasite series) and non-cohesive (breccia-gouge series) material.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:fault-related_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: fault-related material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Aphanitic or porphyritic igneous rock composed of greater than 10 percent groundmass, in which most of the crystals cannot be distinguished with the unaided eye. grainsize is typically less than 1mm. Igneous rocks with 'exotic' composition are excluded from this concept.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:fine_grained_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: fine grained igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock in which M is less than 90, composed of feldspathoids as 10-60 percent of the felsic minerals, sodic plagioclase (An0-An50) and large amounts of mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 14.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:foid_dioritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: foid dioritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock in which M is less than 90, composed of feldspathoids as 10-60 percent of the felsic minerals, calcic plagioclase (An50-An100) and large amounts of mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 14.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:foid_gabbroic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: foid gabbroic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Leucocratic, phaneritic crystalline rock composed of feldspathoids as 10-60 percent of the felsic minerals, alkali feldspar and mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 11.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:foid_syenitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: foid syenitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained crystalline rock containing more than 60 percent feldspathoids in total light-coloured constituents. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 15 or chemically in TAS field F.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:foiditic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: foiditic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock containing more than 60 percent feldspathoids in total light-coloured constituents. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 15
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:foidolite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: foidolite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock in which 10 percent or more of the contained mineral grains are elements in a planar or linear fabric. Cataclastic or glassy character precludes classification with this concept.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:foliated_metamorphic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: foliated metamorphic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material of unspecified consolidation state in which greater than 75 percent of the rock consists of fragments produced as a result of igneous rock-forming process.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:fragmental_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: fragmental igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock in which greater than 75 percent of the rock consists of fragments produced as a result of igneous rock-forming process. Includes pyroclastic rocks, autobreccia associated with lava flows and intrusive breccias. Excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:fragmental_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: fragmental igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate reef rock consisting of a rigid framework of colonies, shells or skeletons, with internal cavities filled with fine sediment. usually created through the activities of colonial organisms.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:framestone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: framestone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock composed essentially of calcic plagioclase (An50 to An100), pyroxene and iron oxides. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 10 as gabbro.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:gabbro
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: gabbros
gabbro

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock composed of 65 percent or more of calcic plagioclase and up to 20 percent quartz or up to 10 percent feldspathoid. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 as gabbro or monzogabbro and foid-bearing varieties.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:gabbroic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: gabbroic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock that consists of greater than 90 percent glass.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:glassy_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: glassy igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated metamorphic rock with bands or lenticles rich in granular minerals alternating with bands or lenticles rich in minerals with a flaky or elongate prismatic habit. Mylonitic foliation or well developed, continuous schistosity (greater than 50 percent of the rock consists of grains participate in a planar or linear fabric) precludes classification with this concept.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:gneiss
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: gneiss

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with recognizable depositional fabric that is grain-supported. contains little or no mud matrix.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:grainstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: grainstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and plagioclase (typically sodic) in variable amounts, usually with biotite and/or hornblende. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 3.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:granite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: granite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and/or plagioclase. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2, 3, 4 and 5 as alkali granite, granite, granodiorite or tonalite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:granitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: granitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting essentially of quartz, sodic plagioclase and lesser amounts of alkali feldspar with minor hornblende and biotite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 4.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:granodiorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: granodiorites
granodiorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic metamorphic rock with granoblastic fabric and very little or no foliation (less than 10 percent of the mineral grains in the rock are elements in a planar or linear fabric).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:granofels
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: granofels

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment containing greater than 30 percent gravel-size particles (greater than 2.0 mm diameter).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:gravel
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: gravel

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic rock that consists of greater than 40 percent hornblende plus pyroxene and has a hornblende to pyroxene ratio greater than 1. Includes olivine hornblendite, olivine-pyroxene hornblendite, pyroxene hornblendite, and hornblendite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:hornblendite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: hornblendite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Granofels composed of a mosaic of equidimensional grains in a characteristically granoblastic or decussate matrix. porphyroblasts or relict phenocrysts may be present. Typically formed by contact metamorphism.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:hornfels
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: hornfels

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Earth material formed as a result of igneous processes, eg. intrusion and cooling of magma in the crust, volcanic eruption.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed as a result of igneous processes, for example intrusion and cooling of magma in the crust, or volcanic eruption.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock that contains features indicative of shock metamorphism, such as microscopic planar deformation features within grains or shatter cones. Includes breccias and melt rocks.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:impact_metamorphic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: impact metamorphic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material with between 52 and 63 percent SiO2.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:intermediate_composition_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: intermediate composition igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with between 52 and 63 percent SiO2.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:intermediate_composition_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: intermediate composition igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment that consists of at least 50 percent iron-bearing minerals (hematite, magnetite, limonite-group, siderite, iron-sulfides), as determined by hand-lens or petrographic analysis. Corresponds to a rock typically containing 15 percent iron by weight.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:iron_rich_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: iron rich sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation state that consists of at least 50 percent iron-bearing minerals (hematite, magnetite, limonite-group, siderite, iron-sulfides), as determined by hand-lens or petrographic analysis. Corresponds to a rock typically containing 15 percent iron by weight.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:iron_rich_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: iron rich sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock that consists of at least 50 percent iron-bearing minerals (hematite, magnetite, limonite-group, siderite, iron-sulfides), as determined by hand-lens or petrographic analysis. Corresponds to a rock typically containing 15 percent iron by weight.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:iron_rich_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: iron rich sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic volcanic rock, typically with spinifex texture of intergrown skeletal and bladed olivine and pyroxene crystals set in abundant glass. Includes picrite, komatiite and meimechite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:komatiitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: komatiitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Tephra in which the average grain size of particles is greater than 2 mm.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:lapilli,_bomb,_or_block_tephra
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: lapilli, bomb, or block tephra

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Pyroclastic rock in which the average grain size of particles is greater than 2 mm.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:lapillistone,_agglomerate,_tuff_breccia
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: lapillistone, agglomerate, tuff breccia

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock consisting of greater than 75 percent fine- to coarse-grained recrystallized calcite and/or dolomite. usually with a granoblastic, saccharoidal texture.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:marble
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: marbres
marble

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed by solid-state mineralogical, chemical and/or structural changes to a pre-existing rock, in response to marked changes in temperature, pressure, shearing stress and chemical environment. generally at depth in the crust.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:metamorphic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: Roches métamorphiques
metamorphic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Silicate metamorphic rock that is pervasively heterogeneous on a meso- to megascopic scale that typically consists of darker and lighter parts. the darker parts usually exhibit features of metamorphic rocks whereas the lighter parts are of igneous-looking appearance.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:migmatite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: migmatites
migmatite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of sodic plagioclase (An0 to An50), alkali feldspar, hornblende and biotite, with or without pyroxene. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 9 as monzodiorite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:monzodiorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: monzodiorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of calcic plagioclase (An50 to An100), alkali feldspar, hornblende and biotite, with or without pyroxene. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 9 as monzogabbro.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:monzogabbro
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: monzogabbro

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock containing almost equal amounts of plagioclase and alkali feldspar with minor amphibole and/or pyroxene and little or no quartz. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 8.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:monzonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: monzonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sediment consisting of less than 30 percent gravel-size (2 mm) particles and with a mud to sand ratio greater than 1. Clasts may be of any composition or origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:mud
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: vases
mud

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sedimentary rock consisting of less than 30 percent gravel-size (2 mm) particles and with a mud to sand ratio greater than 1. Clasts may be of any composition or origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:mudstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: mudstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock characterised by a well developed foliation resulting from tectonic grain size reduction, in which between 50 and 90 percent of the rock volume has undergone grain size reduction. May contain rounded porphyroclasts and lithic fragments of similar composition to minerals in the matrix, fine scale layering with an associated mineral or stretching lineation, anastomosing foliation, S-C fabrics and ribbons.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:mylonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: mylonites
mylonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock characterised by a foliation resulting from tectonic grain size reduction, in which more than 10 percent of the rock volume has undergone grain size reduction. Includes protomylonite, mylonite, ultramylonite, phyllonite and blastomylonite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:mylonitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: mylonitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated material known to have natural, ie. not human-made, origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:natural_unconsolidated_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: natural unconsolidated material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by chemical or biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by chemical or biological processes within the basin of deposition.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:non-clastic_siliceous_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: non-clastic siliceous sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by chemical or biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by chemical or biological processes within the basin of deposition.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:non-clastic_siliceous_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: non-clastic siliceous sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by chemical or biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by chemical or biological processes within the basin of deposition.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:non-clastic_siliceous_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: non-clastic siliceous sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Mud with a sand to mud ratio less than 1 to 9 that contains at least 30 percent skeletal remains of pelagic organisms. Less than 1 percent gravel and less than 50 percent carbonate minerals.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:ooze
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: ooze

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment with color, composition, texture and apparent density indicating greater than 50 percent organic content by weight on a moisture-free basis.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:organic_rich_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: organic rich sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material in which 50 percent or more of the primary sedimentary material is organic carbon.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:organic_rich_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: organic rich sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock with color, composition, texture and apparent density indicating greater than 50 percent organic content by weight on a moisture-free basis.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:organic_rich_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: organic rich sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with discernible grain supported depositional texture, containing greater than 10 percent grains. intergranular spaces are filled by matrix.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:packstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: packstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated organic-rich sediment composed of at least 50 percent semi-carbonised plant remains. individual remains commonly seen with unaided eye. yellowish brown to brownish black. generally fibrous texture. can be plastic or friable. In its natural state it can be readily cut and has a very high moisture content, generally greater than 90 percent.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:peat
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: peat

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Exceptionally coarse grained crystalline rock with interlocking crystals. most grains are 1cm or more diameter. composition is generally that of granite, but the term may refer to the coarse grained facies of any type of igneous rock.usually found as irregular dikes, lenses, or veins associated with plutons or batholiths.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:pegmatite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pegmatite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic rock consisting of more than 40 percent (by volume) olivine with pyroxene and/or amphibole and little or no feldspar. Commonly altered to serpentinite. Includes rocks defined modally in the ultramafic rock classification as dunite, harzburgite, lherzolite, wehrlite, olivinite, pyroxene peridotite, pyroxene hornblende peridotite or hornblende peridotite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:peridotite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: peridotites
peridotite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock in which greater than 10 percent of rock is individual crystals that can be discerned with the unaided eye. Bounding grain size is on the order of 32 to 100 microns. Igneous rocks with 'exotic' composition are excluded from this concept.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:phaneritic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phaneritic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained igneous rock containing feldspathoids and in which alkali feldspar is thought to be more abundant than plagioclase. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 11 and 12, and TAS field Ph.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:phonolitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phonolitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are phosphate minerals.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:phosphate_rich_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phosphate rich sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are phosphate minerals.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:phosphatic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phosphatic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock in which at least 50 percent of the primary or recrystallized constituents are phosphate minerals. Most commonly occurs as a bedded primary or reworked secondary marine rock, composed of microcrystalline carbonate fluorapatite in the form of lamina, pellets, oolites and nodules, and skeletal, shell and bone fragments.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:phosphorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phosphorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock with a well developed, continuous schistosity, an average grain size between 0.1 and 0.5 millimeters, and a silvery sheen on cleavage surfaces. Individual phyllosilicate grains are barely visible with the unaided eye.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:phyllite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phyllite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Mylonitic rock composed largely of fine-grained mica that imparts a sheen to foliation surfaces. may have flaser lamination, isoclinal folding, and deformed veins, which indicate significant shearing. Macroscopically resembles phyllite, but formed by mechanical degradation of initially coarser rock.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:phyllonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phyllonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock that contains conspicuous phenocrysts in a finer grained groundmass. groundmass itself may be phaneritic or fine-grained.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:porphyry
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: porphyry

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock characterised by a discernible planar or linear fabric resulting from tectonic reduction of grain size in which between 10 and 50 percent of the rock volume has undergone grain size reduction. Much of the original rock texture and mineralogy may remain intact.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:protomylonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: protomylonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Pyroclastic rock in which more than 75 percent of the rock (by volume) is composed of pyroclasts greater than 64 mm in diameter (blocks and/or bombs). Includes agglomerate.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:pyroclastic_breccia
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pyroclastic breccia

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fragmental igneous material that consists of more than 75 percent of particles formed by disruption as a direct result of volcanic action.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:pyroclastic_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pyroclastic material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fragmental igneous rock that consists of greater than 75 percent fragments produced as a direct result of eruption or extrusion of magma from within the earth onto its surface. Includes autobreccia associated with lava flows and excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:pyroclastic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pyroclastic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic phaneritic igneous rock composed almost entirely of one or more pyroxenes and occasionally biotite, hornblende and olivine. Includes rocks defined modally in the ultramafic rock classification as olivine pyroxenite, olivine-hornblende pyroxenite, pyroxenite, orthopyroxenite, clinopyroxenite and websterite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:pyroxenite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pyroxenite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock that contains greater than 60 percent quartz.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:quartz_rich_phaneritic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: quartz rich phaneritic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock consisting of greater than or equal to 75 percent quartz. typically granoblastic texture.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:quartzite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: quartzites
quartzite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine-grained igneous rock, typically porphyritic, consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar (often as phenocrysts), with minor plagioclase and biotite, in a microcrystalline, cryptocrystalline or glassy groundmass. Flow texture is common. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2 and 3 or chemically in TAS Field R as rhyolite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:rhyolitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: rhyolitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Consolidated aggregate of one or more EarthMaterials, or a body of undifferentiated mineral matter, or of solid organic material. Includes mineral aggregates such as granite, shale, marble. glassy matter such as obsidian. and organic material such a coal. Excludes unconsolidated materials.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sediment in which less than 30 percent of particles are gravel (greater than 2 mm in diameter) and the sand to mud ratio is at least 1.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:sand
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sables
sand

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sedimentary rock in which less than 30 percent of particles are greater than 2 mm in diameter (gravel) and the sand to mud ratio is at least 1.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:sandstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: grès
sandstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated phaneritic metamorphic rock with well developed, continuous schistosity (greater than 50 percent of mineral grains with a tabular, lamellar, or prismatic crystallographic habit that are oriented in a continuous planar or linear fabric).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:schist
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: schistes
schist

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated phaneritic metamorphic rock with well developed, continuous schistosity (greater than 50 percent of mineral grains with a tabular, lamellar, or prismatic crystallographic habit that are oriented in a continuous planar or linear fabric).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:schist_1
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: schistes bleus
schist

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated phaneritic metamorphic rock with well developed, continuous schistosity (greater than 50 percent of mineral grains with a tabular, lamellar, or prismatic crystallographic habit that are oriented in a continuous planar or linear fabric).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:schist_2
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: schistes noirs
schist

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated phaneritic metamorphic rock with well developed, continuous schistosity (greater than 50 percent of mineral grains with a tabular, lamellar, or prismatic crystallographic habit that are oriented in a continuous planar or linear fabric).
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:schist_3
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: schistes verts
schist

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated material consisting of an aggregation of particles transported or deposited by air, water or ice, or that accumulated by other natural agents, such as chemical precipitation, and that forms in layers on the Earth's surface. Includes epiclastic deposits.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiments
sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material formed by accumulation of solid fragmental material deposited by air, water or ice, or material that accumulated by other natural agents such as chemical precipitation from solution or secretion by organisms. Includes both sediment and sedimentary rock. Includes epiclastic deposits.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed by accumulation and cementation of solid fragmental material deposited by air, water or ice, or as a result of other natural agents, such as precipitation from solution, the accumulation of organic material, or from biogenic processes, including secretion by organisms. Includes epiclastic deposits.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock consisting of more than 75 percent serpentine-group minerals, eg. antigorite, chrysotile or lizardite. accessory chlorite, talc and magnetite may be present. derived from hydration of ferromagnesian silicate minerals such as olivine and pyroxene.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:serpentinite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: serpentinite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Laminated mudstone that will part or break along thin, closely spaced layers parallel to stratification.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:shale
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: shale

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Compact, fine grained rock with an average grain size less than 0.032 millimeter and a well developed schistosity (slaty cleavage), and hence can be split into slabs or thin plates.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:slate
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: slate

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock with M less than 90, consisting mainly of alkali feldspar and plagioclase. minor quartz or nepheline may be present, along with pyroxene, amphibole or biotite. Includes rocks classified in QAPF fields 6, 7 and 8 as syenite or monzonite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:syenitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: syenitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated pyroclastic material in which greater than 75 percent of the fragments are deposited as a direct result of volcanic processes and the deposit has not been reworked by epiclastic processes. Includes ash, lapilli tephra, bomb tephra, block tephra and unconsolidated agglomerate.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:tephra
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: tephra

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained crystalline igneous rock containing essential feldspathoids and in which plagioclase is more abundant than alkali feldspar. Includes rocks classified in QAPF field 14 or chemically in TAS field U1 as basanite or tephrite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:tephritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: tephritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of quartz and intermediate plagioclase, usually with biotite and amphibole. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 5.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:tonalite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: tonalites
tonalite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine-grained volcanic rock consisting of alkali feldspar and minor mafic minerals, typically amphibole or mica. typically porphyritic. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 6, 7 and 8 or chemically in TAS Field T as trachyte or latite.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:trachytic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: trachytic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Pyroclastic rock in which less than 75 percent of the rock (by volume) is composed of pyroclasts more than 64 mm in diameter. Includes tuff breccia, lapillistone, lapilli tuff and ash tuff.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:tuff
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: tuff

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with less than 45 percent SiO2.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:ultrabasic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: ultrabasic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock characterised by a well developed foliation resulting from tectonic grain size reduction, where more than 90 percent of the rock volume has undergone grain size reduction. May contain a few rounded porphyroclasts and lithic fragments of similar composition to minerals in the matrix. Fine scale layering and an associated mineral or stretching lineation may be present, but rock is commonly very fine grained, with primary structures and porphyroclasts obliterated to form a homogeneous, dense rock.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:ultramylonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: ultramylonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: CompoundMaterial composed of an aggregation of particles that do not adhere to each other strongly enough that the aggregate can be considered a solid in its own right.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:unconsolidated_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: unconsolidated material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone that contains between 15 and 75 percent matrix of unspecified origin.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:1986:wackestone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: wackestone
